Articles.Content:
I think I found where the 1.0 heatshield textures come from...

![orion-concept.png?itok=n6IH2Lsw](http://www.nasa.gov/sites/default/files/styles/1x1_cardfeed/public/thumbnails/image/orion-concept.png?itok=n6IH2Lsw)

See? ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)
Not sure what you're referring to, but the windows on that pod makes me think of batman.

> 
> Not sure what you're referring to, but the windows on that pod makes me think of batman.

It's NASA's Orion command pod

> 
> Not sure what you're referring to, but the windows on that pod makes me think of batman.

Lol, that's the Orion capsule, the textures are from the Orions heatshield.

Edit: ninja'd
*Oh no*... here it comes... NASA copyright infringement. ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)
Batman has a space shuttle too? That dude is rich.

> 
> *Oh no*... here it comes... NASA copyright infringement. ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)

It's a derivative based on the original... somehow even if it is nearly an exact copy that makes it alright. ![:sealed:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_lipssealed.gif)

> 
> *Oh no*... here it comes... NASA copyright infringement. ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)

Who created the design/picture? If the contractor did, you may have something there. If NASA itself did, it's *puuublic domaaainÃ¢â‚¬Â¦*
NASA is unlikely to sue SQUAD after collaborating with them to make all the parts for the ARM update ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> Who created the design/picture? If the contractor did, you may have something there. If NASA itself did, it's *puuublic domaaainÃ¢â‚¬Â¦*

Please... just because something is online, or even a work by the government, doesn't mean it is public domain. It's a common misinterpretation of the law that has been spread just like the vague notions on what is, or is not, public domain (for instance, someone made a xenon octo-8 texture and public domained the mod... of course SQUAD still holds the rights to the original model which was included in the mod.)

"Works by the government" is very vague, if NASA fully designed the rocket, but then hired an artist to draw that, or used software that had a "derivative works" license (take paper ksp models, the art is still copyrightable even though it is put together to create a derivative work), it isn't a "work by the government" (not quite public domain). If NASA claims that the provided model is technical data, it again isn't a "work by the government"; we don't just let other governments enjoy the spoils of our research.

The whole thing is complicated; unless you're YouTube/Wikipedia/"User Content Sites" and can ignore copyright laws because you use the umbrella tree to claim you cannot be held accountable for the massive lawbreaking of your users.
